title: I want more justifiable reasoning than a one sentance context for your balance changes, Riot.
body:
Where is the "internal data" that you guys go off of? 

Where are the metrics that told you it was okay to buff {{champion:121}} the way you did?

Where in the meta data does it say that {{champion:104}} has been okay for the past 20 patches? Especially after {{item:3095}} and Dark Harvest have been picked on him frequently?

Where in this construct of all knowing data does it say {{champion:84}}  doesn't need any nerfs to her over bearing kit?

Where in this matrix of data does it say it's okay for {{champion:6}}  to drown out so many picks in the top lane?

Where in this library of data does it say that {{champion:24}}  is in an okay spot, and is no way overbearing to other champions in the top lane?

Where in this helix of forbidden knowledge is it okay for {{champion:202}} , a champion who was designed around being immobile, to have the movement speed of Vayne with her ultimate on, ALL THE TIME?

Where in any of this damn data, is it okay for around 20 champions to completely dominate the entire game?

I'll tell you what this data really is, $$$$$$$$$$$, yeah. Kha championship golden chroma coming out? Want more than just the hardcore mains to play him during worlds? Buff the champion so everyone is interested in playing this champion and buying the worlds pass.

Good job riot, daddy Tencent has his hand so far up your ass that he's playing the fucking saxophone with your vocal cords.

Pathetic.

I wouldn't mind reading an essay written by the balance team justifying their changes.

They don't. The only data they're concerned with is whether or not people will watch their tournaments. Not whether or not the game is in a healthy state. Of course, they'd never admit that and we'd never know for sure 100%, but given the changes they've been making lately, it's an entirely reasonable conclusion to come to through abductive reasoning.

Throughout its entire existence, I've always thought League was a flawed game, but even at its worst, it still had some semblance of fun. The game right now is provably the exact opposite. Yet, Riot clearly and obviously doesn't care, unless they are forced to care by the players (as evidenced by half a year of negative feedback they've been receiving and casually ignoring). Have you EVER encountered a product, movie, game, etc. that was good because the people behind it forced themselves to do something, based on an entirely flawed premise of what they think their customer base wants? Yeah, neither have I. 

Riot THINKS they know what people want to watch at Worlds. They don't actually KNOW. They THINK they know what kind of meta we want to play. They don't actually KNOW. They're making guesses with these changes. 

The "data" that they use to make those changes is always stated in order to justify the changes from the start, regardless of their validity. Even if they do have "data" that they're using to make these changes, it would still be the wrong way to do it, because League is a game. Your personal experience/feeling of the game is part of the equation, which is something Riot no longer holds in high regard. The right way to do it is to consider both the data and the feel of the game equally, but it's _hard_ and takes time to do that. So they won't.

Riot will never say "We're balancing around pro play and ignoring the 99.99% of the rest of the population." The reasons you're looking for have to be vetted before being sent out, which is why most statements put out by Riot are so unbelievably disingenuous. Even if they gave you a reason, you shouldn't trust it.
